index.html.title: index
index.html.description:
BS ROLLS (CHECKS)
VIBE
HEARTHS AND EMBERS

bs-(between-stabbings)/bs-rolls-(checks).title: BS ROLLS (CHECKS)
bs-(between-stabbings)/bs-rolls-(checks).description:
Used to resolve arguments or environmental obstacles. Pool: 2d6 Base + Prism X d6. Success: Each die showing 4, 5, or 6. Sixes count double.
Failure: Each die showing 3, 2, or 1. Ones count double.
Difficulty: DC 1-2: Standard task. DC 3: Strenuous. DC 4: Dangerous/Elite. DC 6+: Near-impossible.

bs-(between-stabbings)/level_up.html.title: LEVEL_UP
bs-(between-stabbings)/level_up.html.description:
Level-Ups occur during rests/between session, and, through SHARDS accumulated during travels allow for: Increasing a single Prism's Value (-5)
Removing Cards (-3) *A player’s deck must always contain at least 4 BACKBONE Cards. Adding Keywords to Cards (-3)
Purging STATUS cards (-3)
Adding new BACKBONE Cards (-2) Changing Keywords already on Cards (-2) Removing Keywords from Cards (+1)

bs-(between-stabbings)/shards.html.title: SHARDS
bs-(between-stabbings)/shards.html.description:
Shards are the universal currency of the Hearth. They act as both long-term progression and "Crushable" mid-combat consumables: Cost: 0 ENERGY.
Effect: Add one Secondary Non-Scaling Keyword (AREA DELAY DISCARD DRAW ECHO LIGHTNING PIERCE RETAIN VAMPIRIC.) to the next card played, OR
grant +1 ENERGY / +1 Card / 1 DMG. Crushed Shards are gone forever and cannot be used for progression.

character/cards/keywords/primary/brace.h.title: BRACE
character/cards/keywords/primary/brace.h.description: Pool of Value. Increases Block efficiency by 1; pool decreases by 1 when HP damage is taken. Scales with GUILE

character/cards/keywords/primary/counter.title: COUNTER
character/cards/keywords/primary/counter.description: Grants Value stacks. Deals Value DMG back when hit; halve stacks (round up) after each trigger. Scales with GUILE

character/cards/keywords/primary/empower.title: EMPOWER
character/cards/keywords/primary/empower.description: Pool of Value. Increases DMG by 1 per hit; pool decreases by 1 per hit. Scales with MIGHT

character/cards/keywords/primary/focus.h.title: FOCUS
character/cards/keywords/primary/focus.h.description: Adds Value to the numeric effect of the next card played. Scales with INSIGHT

character/cards/keywords/primary/guard.h.title: GUARD
character/cards/keywords/primary/guard.h.description: Grants Value Block. Scales with GUILE

character/cards/keywords/primary/mend.ht.title: MEND
character/cards/keywords/primary/mend.ht.description: Restores Value Vitality. Scales with INSIGHT

character/cards/keywords/primary/strike..title: STRIKE
character/cards/keywords/primary/strike..description: Deal Value DMG. Scales with MIGHT

character/cards/keywords/primary/ward.ht.title: WARD
character/cards/keywords/primary/ward.ht.description: Negates the next negative STATUS or Keyword applied by an enemy. Stacks.

character/cards/keywords/secondary/area..title: AREA
character/cards/keywords/secondary/area..description: Affects ALL enemies, or ALL allies.

character/cards/keywords/secondary/bleed.title: BLEED
character/cards/keywords/secondary/bleed.description: Deal Value DMG again at the end of enemy's turn, once. Scales with GUILE

character/cards/keywords/secondary/delay.title: DELAY
character/cards/keywords/secondary/delay.description: Card takes effect at the start of next turn.

character/cards/keywords/secondary/echo..title: ECHO
character/cards/keywords/secondary/echo..description: Retrigger previous card (with a matching Primary) with all values set to 1.

character/cards/keywords/secondary/ignit.title: IGNITE
character/cards/keywords/secondary/ignit.description: Deal Value DMG at the end of the turn, then decrease stacks by 1. Scales with INSIGHT

character/cards/keywords/secondary/light.title: LIGHTNING
character/cards/keywords/secondary/light.description: Hits two random targets (or one target twice if its the only one available).

character/cards/keywords/secondary/merci.title: MERCILESS
character/cards/keywords/secondary/merci.description: If target has 0 Block, add Value to DMG. Scales with MIGHT

character/cards/keywords/secondary/pierc.title: PIERCE
character/cards/keywords/secondary/pierc.description: Ignores Block. Uses the higher Prism Value. Scales with MIGHT OR GUILE, whichever's higher.

character/cards/keywords/secondary/retai.title: RETAIN
character/cards/keywords/secondary/retai.description: Card stays in hand if unplayed.

character/cards/keywords/exhaust.html.title: EXHAUST
character/cards/keywords/exhaust.html.description: Cards with this keyword are removed from the deck after being played.

character/cards/status_cards/reshuffle/a.title: ASH
character/cards/status_cards/reshuffle/a.description: Cost: 2 Energy. Exhaust when played. RETAIN

character/cards/status_cards/reshuffle/e.title: EROSION
character/cards/status_cards/reshuffle/e.description: Cost: 1 Energy. When drawn, take 1 DMG. DRAW 1 card when played.

character/cards/status_cards/reshuffle/m.title: MIST
character/cards/status_cards/reshuffle/m.description: When drawn, shuffle a MIST into the Draw Pile. RETAIN

character/cards/status_cards/doubt.html.title: DOUBT
character/cards/status_cards/doubt.html.description: RETAIN At the end of turn, lose 1 BURSTcharge.

character/cards/status_cards/injury.html.title: INJURY
character/cards/status_cards/injury.html.description: Cost: 2 Energy. RETAINEXHAUST. While in hand, your BURST is Locked.

character/cards/status_cards/panic.html.title: PANIC
character/cards/status_cards/panic.html.description: Cost: 1 Energy. DISCARD another card from your hand. It does not contribute to Burst Gauge when discarded this way. RETAIN

character/cards/status_cards/trembling.h.title: TREMBLING
character/cards/status_cards/trembling.h.description: Cost: 1 Energy. EXHAUST. While in hand, playing another card deals Self DMG = ENERGY cost of the card played.

character/cards/status_cards/wound.html.title: WOUND
character/cards/status_cards/wound.html.description: When drawn, take 2 PIERCE DMG.

character/cards/backbone.html.title: BACKBONE
character/cards/backbone.html.description: Starter Cards with only One Keyword, they have an innate +3 Value. Backbone cards are limited to the single-keyword cards provided in the Starting Oath Deck. Adding any keyword or modifying them turns them into Custom cards, removing the +3 bonus. Likewise, removing extra Keywords from a CUSTOMS card brings it back to a Backbone once its left with just One Keyword. Deck Rule: A player’s deck must always contain at least 4 Backbone Cards.

character/cards/customs.html.title: CUSTOMS
character/cards/customs.html.description:
Custom Cards have more than One Keyword. Can be UNIQUE or upgraded from BACKBONE cards.
Card ENERGY Cost Scales with Keyword count (1:1), making complex cards more expensive to play.
They use only the related Prism's Value for effects, where applicable, without the BACKBONE reliability bonus.

character/cards/status.html.title: STATUS
character/cards/status.html.description: Status cards are Negative effects applied by Enemies, Events, or through losing all VITALS. Unless noted otherwise, these are Unplayable, and disappear at the end of combat.

character/cards/unique.html.title: UNIQUE
character/cards/unique.html.description: Unique Cards are ones gained through Backstory, or Campaign Events, usually crafted by the GM.

character/oaths/conduit/bursts.html.title: BURSTS
character/oaths/conduit/bursts.html.description:
Enemy loses all GUARD and COUNTER.
STRIKE LIGHTNING BLEED/IGNITE.
Play up to INSIGHT cards for free, if they scale with INSIGHT (from other players too).
IGNITE 2 AREA (Enemies). Already IGNITE enemies take their total IGNITE stacks as DMG immediately.

character/oaths/conduit/oath_of_the_cond.title: OATH_OF_THE_CONDUIT
character/oaths/conduit/oath_of_the_cond.description:
Your Prism scores are as follows: 0 MIGHT
1 GUILE
2 INSIGHT You may allocate a single point to a chosen Prism. Your Starting deck consists of:
3x STRIKE
3x GUARD And,
4x FOCUS Or;
4x MEND

character/oaths/conduit/passives.html.title: PASSIVES
character/oaths/conduit/passives.html.description:
When you trigger an ECHO keyword, the values are set to 2 (usually 1).
Your IGNITE effects deal damage at the start of the enemy's turn.
Allies can use your INSIGHT if its higher than theirs, when playing an INSIGHT-scaling card.
FOCUS INSIGHT the first card played each turn.

character/oaths/crucible/bursts.html.title: BURSTS
character/oaths/crucible/bursts.html.description:
Double current Empower/BRACE stacks.
Gain 2 X Might X GUARD.
Strike with Empower multiplier (DMG = Strike X Empower, instead of Strike + 1).
Mend Half Max HP, grant Might Burst charges to another Ember.

character/oaths/crucible/oath_of_the_cru.title: OATH_OF_THE_CRUCIBLE
character/oaths/crucible/oath_of_the_cru.description:
Your Prism scores are as follows: 2 Might
1 Guile
0 Insight You may allocate a single point to a chosen Prism. Your Starting deck consists of: Either;
6x Strike
4x Guard Or;
6x Guard
4x Strike

character/oaths/crucible/passives.html.title: PASSIVES
character/oaths/crucible/passives.html.description:
Regain Might VITALS at combat end.
If a STRIKE kills an enemy, all excess damage is applied to a random target.
Might-based discards for Burst charges grant +3 instead of +2.
Whenever the Hearth takes VITALS damage, gain +1 Burst Charge.

character/oaths/mistwalker/bursts.html.title: BURSTS
character/oaths/mistwalker/bursts.html.description: Reduce the cost of all cards currently dealt to 1 this turn. Next card played this turn takes effect 2 extra times (so 3 activations total). Stun an enemy. (Pause their Intent) Draw Guile cards, regain 1 ENERGY.

character/oaths/mistwalker/oath_of_the_m.title: OATH_OF_THE_MISTWALKER
character/oaths/mistwalker/oath_of_the_m.description:
Your Prism scores are as follows: 1 Might
2 Guile
0 Insight You may allocate a single point to a chosen Prism. Your Starting deck consists of:
3x Strike
5x Guard
2x Counter

character/oaths/mistwalker/passives.html.title: PASSIVES
character/oaths/mistwalker/passives.html.description:
Dealing unblocked HP damage grants +1 Burst Charge. Negate the first negative STATUS applied to the Hearth each combat.
Start combats with Guile Brace/Empower.
Killing an enemy draws 1 Card OR grants 1 ENERGY.

character/oaths/burst.html.title: BURST
character/oaths/burst.html.description:
Each player has an individual Ember Gauge (0-10). Charging: Play: +1 Charge per 1 ENERGY spent on your cards.
Sacrifice: +2 Charges per 1 ENERGY cost of a card willingly discarded from hand. Activation:
Costs 10 Charges and 2 ENERGY. Burst-Lock: Only one player can trigger a Burst per turn, and the Bursting Ember cannot generate Burst Charges on the turn they used their Burst. * Additionally, when drawing cards, the player that Bursted is excluded from the calculation (N x 3) for that turn.

character/inventory.html.title: INVENTORY
character/inventory.html.description:
Inventory is strictly divided to separate narrative utility from mechanical progression. Tools (~3 Slots): Functional items (Rope, Flint/Steel, Chalk, Medicine). These grant Advantage (+1 Success) on specific BS ROLLS (CHECKS). Gatekeeping: Certain tasks (climbing a sheer cliff) are impossible (DC ) without the specific item (Rope). Curios (~3 Slots): Personal narrative items or unique trophies. These have zero mechanical weight and exist solely for character flavour or specific narrative purposes. Shards (Numerical Value): Weightless essence stored directly in the Ember’s resonance. Coin Pouch: Traditional currency used for mundane trade (food, lodging, information).
Armaments (Swords, Staves, Plate) are Narrative Justifications. They do not occupy slots because they are the physical justification of your 10-card deck. A player doesn't "get a sword" for +1 DMG; they have Strike cards because they have a sword.
These are rare, non-consumable items that sit on the Hearth Sheet (Alongside VITALS, ENERGY, etc.).
They provide non-Oath Passives to the Hearth, but have either low number values, or specific conditions to make them click. Examples would Include: The Stone Heart: The Hearth is immune to the first Yellow (Disruptive) Intent of every combat.
The Whispering Coil: When the Sync-Axis is in Harmony (+3 SYNC-AXIS), Mend effects are doubled.
Heavy Greataxe: Adds Pierce to the first Strike each turn.
The Hearth can carry 3 Artifacts (Active Passives) and 6 Mundane Items (Tools/Curios). Shards do not count toward this limit; they are stored within the "Ember" itself.

ds-(during-stabbings)/enemies/cinder-gol.title: Cinder Goliath
ds-(during-stabbings)/enemies/cinder-gol.description: ADD (PANIC)ADD (TREMBLING)ADD (ASH)ADD (2x HOLLOW)ADD (DOUBT)ADD (INJURY)STRIKE (10)STRIKE (6)STRIKE (2x 6)STRIKE (8)GUARD (10)GUARD (20)YES/STARTD6 DEBUFFABOVE 25 HP?STRIKE (10)GUARD (10)STRIKE (8), GUARD (20), ADD (2x ASH)FOR EVERY STATUS IN HANDS EXTRA D6 INTENT (1,2 RED, 3,4 BLUE, 5,6 YELLOW)HP = 45NO?ADD (2x HOLLOW)

ds-(during-stabbings)/enemies/rulings.ht.title: RULINGS
ds-(during-stabbings)/enemies/rulings.ht.description:
Enemies operate on fixed values and unique behaviours, ignoring player Prism constraints. This allows the GM to create "impossible" threats that require specific card or behaviour answers.
An enemy's "Statblock" is essentially their Intent Loop/Algorithm + their HP.
Ex.:
Husk - 7 HP
Intent: Strike (6) -> Guard (8) -> Strike (8) -> Guard (12) -> LOOP.
This makes enemies predictable (rewards knowledge/experience and learning), and decreases GM's mental load drastically, while keeping the players on their toes whenever they meet something new.

ds-(during-stabbings)/playerside/energy..title: ENERGY
ds-(during-stabbings)/playerside/energy..description:
Used to play cards. The cost of a card equals the number of Keywords on it (Min. 1).
A Party's Energy Max is calculated as follows: N (no. Players) X 2

ds-(during-stabbings)/playerside/owner_p.title: OWNER_PRIORITY
ds-(during-stabbings)/playerside/owner_p.description: To prevent Alpha-gaming, the player who owns the card currently being played has Absolute Veto. They decide the targets, the timing, and whether to discard it for Burst charges. Negotiation is encouraged, but the Owner's word is law.

ds-(during-stabbings)/playerside/sync-ax.title: SYNC-AXIS
ds-(during-stabbings)/playerside/sync-ax.description: The relationship between Embers dictates the combat playstyle. The scale ranges from -3 to +3, and is tied to ENERGY and DMG variables. | Level | State | Combat Bonus | Combat Penalty | |---|---|---|---| | +3 | Harmony | +3 Shared Energy per turn. | Take +1 incoming damage. | | +2 | Bonded | +2 Shared Energy per turn. | Take Full incoming damage. | | +1 | Aligned | +1 Shared Energy per turn. | Take Full incoming damage. | | 0 | Indifferent | No bonus energy. | No damage mitigation. | | -1 | Friction | 0 Bonus Energy. | Buffer: -1 DMG from all incoming hits. | | -2 | Distant | 0 Bonus Energy. | Buffer: -2 DMG from all incoming hits. | | -3 | Discord | -1 Max Energy. | Buffer: -3 DMG from all incoming hits. |

ds-(during-stabbings)/playerside/turns.h.title: TURNS

ds-(during-stabbings)/playerside/vitals..title: VITALS
ds-(during-stabbings)/playerside/vitals..description:
This is the Sum of All Players' Prisms + [N (no. Players) X 2] When Vitals hits 0, the deck's top card is flipped, and the owner must decide: Burden: Add 2 STATUS cards to the shared deck. These last between combats until cleared.
Shatter: Permanently remove 1 of the CUSTOMS of their choice from the pool. Trauma: A player permanently reduces one Prism by 1.

lore/world/vibe.html.title: VIBE
lore/world/vibe.html.description: Low fantasy: magic is ubiquitous but weakened. People usually know someone who uses it for something more, but almost nobody can use it Well - in a controlled manner, while retaining power. Most common folk have a hard time with just one of these dimensions. Anyone can light a torch with a flick of their fingers, but someone with enough aptitude and strength to cast a ray of fire is one in a million. Dark Fantasy: The world is undoubtably a "Bad Place to Be in". People assume the worst in people, The weather usually sucks, and it is dangerous "out there" even for Embers. The environment is hostile, often shrouded in the GREY MIST, making travel suicidal without the light of a Hearth. Gritty: The players are not expected to be "heroes in shining armours, come to save the world". They can be, of course, if they will it, but morally grey and even antagonistic options are on the table still.

lore/cinders.html.title: CINDERS
lore/cinders.html.description: Just as there are the Hearthbonded Embers, there are also "stray Embers", or "Cinders". Embers without a Hearth, either because of tragedy, or neglect, they suffer alone. These individuals are a lore thing mostly, meaning - unplayable, and make for great adversaries. Ranging from "Mad geniuses" who "made it work", to individuals broken by trauma, lashing out at the unjust world. If bonding is so necessary, how do solo adversaries survive? They consume others. A Cinder doesn't have their Hearth; they seek Fuel. They kidnap low-aptitude people and "burn" through them to stabilize their own LORE/WORLD/RELIGION-PHILOSOPHY/EROSION. This gives the players a clear, gritty objective: stop the Cinder from using the local village as a life support.

lore/hearths-and-embers.html.title: HEARTHS AND EMBERS
lore/hearths-and-embers.html.description: People with spiked Prism aptitudes. The cost of power is life. Embers suffer a shortened lifespan, burning their years away the moment this flame blooms within them for the first time. Despite that, it's a gift, one that manifests randomly and powerfully, and comes at a horrid price. Players are called Embers, groups of bonded Embers are called Hearths. This bond acts as a "Resonance Buffer," preventing the individuals from "detonating" or collapsing into a Hollow state. Hearths can form due to: Rituals done by the Embers themselves, or even without the Embers' choice/knowledge via grimoires or other artifacts. Life experiences: a Bond is likely to form during a shared traumatic event, or, for the lucky ones, it can build up after years of closeness with one another. Bonding with other Embers allows for cleaner channelling - which translates nicely into extra energy per party member. Because Embers forget their pasts (due to LORE/WORLD/RELIGION-PHILOSOPHY/EROSION), they often lack a traditional moral compass. They act on instinct, immediate survival, or the orders of whoever is currently guiding them.

prisms/guile.html.title: GUILE
prisms/guile.html.description: Precision, resource management, and reactive defense. Keywords: Guard, BRACE, Counter, Bleed, Pierce (Precision), Draw.

prisms/insight.html.title: INSIGHT
prisms/insight.html.description: Tactical manipulation, force multiplication, and metaphysical stability. Keywords: Focus, Ward, Ignite, Lightning, Mend.

prisms/might.html.title: MIGHT
prisms/might.html.description: Physical force, momentum, and brute-force attrition. Keywords: Strike, Empower, Merciless, Pierce (Brute), Discard.

info_type.description: Will this feature be placed before, after, or inside (at the beggining or end).

info_featurePlacement.description: Where to place this feature on the page. (Relative to the selector)

info_displayTitle.description: Descriptive title to show above the feature

info_showFrontmatterTags.description: Show tags defined in the frontmatter of the document at the top of the page.

info_featurePlacement.description: Where to place this feature on the page. (Relative to the selector)

info_showCustomIcons.description: Show custom icons for files and folders

info_showDefaultFolderIcons.description: Show a default icon of a folder for every folder in the tree

info_showDefaultFileIcons.description: Show a default icon of a file for every file in the tree

info_defaultFolderIcon.description: The icon to use for folders. Prefix with 'lucide//' to use a Lucide icon

info_defaultFileIcon.description: The icon to use for files. Prefix with 'lucide//' to use a Lucide icon

info_defaultMediaIcon.description: The icon to use for media files. Prefix with 'lucide//' to use a Lucide icon

info_exposeStartingPath.description: Whether or not to show the current file in the file tree when the page is first loaded

info_selector.description: CSS selector for an element. The feature will be placed relative to this element.

info_type.description: Will this feature be placed before, after, or inside (at the beggining or end).

info_featurePlacement.description: Where to place this feature on the page. (Relative to the selector)

info_displayTitle.description: Descriptive title to show above the feature

info_selector.description: CSS selector for an element. The feature will be placed relative to this element.

info_type.description: Will this feature be placed before, after, or inside (at the beggining or end).

info_featurePlacement.description: Where to place this feature on the page. (Relative to the selector)

info_displayTitle.description: Descriptive title to show above the feature

info_minCollapseDepth.description: Only allow outline items to be collapsed if they are at least this many levels deep in the tree.

info_selector.description: CSS selector for an element. The feature will be placed relative to this element.

info_type.description: Will this feature be placed before, after, or inside (at the beggining or end).

info_featurePlacement.description: Where to place this feature on the page. (Relative to the selector)

info_displayTitle.description: Descriptive title to show above the feature

info_selector.description: CSS selector for an element. The feature will be placed relative to this element.

info_type.description: Will this feature be placed before, after, or inside (at the beggining or end).

info_featurePlacement.description: Where to place this feature on the page. (Relative to the selector)

info_displayTitle.description: Descriptive title to show above the feature

info_showOrphanNodes.description: Show nodes that are not connected to any other nodes.

info_showAttachments.description: Show attachments like images and PDFs as nodes in the graph.

info_allowGlobalGraph.description: Allow the user to view the global graph of all nodes.

info_allowExpand.description: Allow the user to pop-out the graph view to take up the whole screen

info_attractionForce.description: How much should linked nodes attract each other? This will make the graph appear more clustered.

info_linkLength.description: How long should the links between nodes be? The shorter the links the more connected nodes will cluster together.

info_repulsionForce.description: How much should nodes repel each other? This will make disconnected parts more spread out.

info_centralForce.description: How much should nodes be attracted to the center? This will make the graph appear more dense and circular.

info_edgePruning.description: Edges with a length above this threshold will not be rendered, however they will still contribute to the simulation. This can help large tangled graphs look more organised. Hovering over a node will still display these links.

info_minNodeRadius.description: How small should the smallest nodes be? The smaller a node is the less it will attract other nodes.

info_maxNodeRadius.description: How large should the largest nodes be? Nodes are sized by how many links they have. The larger a node is the more it will attract other nodes. This can be used to create a good grouping around the most important nodes.

info_allowResizing.description: Whether or not to allow the sidebars to be resized

info_allowCollapsing.description: Whether or not to allow the sidebars to be collapsed

info_rightDefaultWidth.description: The default width of the right sidebar

info_leftDefaultWidth.description: The default width of the left sidebar

info_selector.description: CSS selector for an element. The feature will be placed relative to this element.

info_type.description: Will this feature be placed before, after, or inside (at the beggining or end).

info_featurePlacement.description: Where to place this feature on the page. (Relative to the selector)

info_sourcePath.description: The local path to the source .html file which will be included.

info_allowFoldingLists.description: Whether or not to allow lists to be folded

info_allowFoldingHeadings.description: Whether or not to allow headings to be folded

info_siteUrl.description: The url that this site will be hosted at

info_authorName.description: The name of the author of the site

bodyClasses: publish css-settings-manager styled-scrollbars show-inline-title show-ribbon is-focused
